: I met her during the tutorial. Before our entry fees were taken, while Usa-san showed us how to play the Game. We were all playing a party game by midnight, hanging out, having fun, karaoke. Luna was singing; that's what drew me to her. We were singing together, for a bit, laughing and having a good time. At the start of Day One, I lost my ability to sing. Luna kept hers, and... kept singing. She gave me a music player so I'd always have music on me, and we were bouncing around to it... we were the second pair to pact, and the first /intentional/ pacting, deciding that we'd be magical girls together.
nods. "That definitely sounds like Luna."

: She told me about you, some. She really looked up to you, loved you... refused to admit you were cute. We talked about our families and all. Got to know each other some. When we were fighting, we discovered we had the power of fire, and were... calling our attacks, and laughing, in the most showy manner possible. We tried to burn a police car. She managed to utterly wreck it, but our firepower wouldn't kick in out of the Noise Plane.
: How did she manage that?
: Kicked it a lot. Hit it. Generally became a whirlwind of very vengeful destruction. Cute whirlwind, though.
nods. "Ah, a police car. That's what hit her, if I recall."
: Yeah. She figured that out.
: Did she try to kill any cops, too?
: Nah. We can't touch the RGers.
: I wouldn't have put it past her to try anyway.
: Given what happened to her... I think it might have been almost fair.
: Yeah. I wouldn't have blamed her. Not exactly.
: So, you two used fire?
: Hehe. Whenever we were fighting. It became our thing-- a pair of pyromaniacal magical girls. Set everything on fire in the flashiest ways possible.

: That very first night, we went through all the shops, laughing and making friends with shopkeepers. Trying to get along with everyone we met. She took an immediate shine to Sonata-san. Malcolm-- one of the reapers-- gave us pillows and blankets to borrow and we curled up with each other like sleepy kittens. That became how we slept. Just... clinging to each other. We clung to each other a lot even when we were awake... especially as things got scary, and people started dying... well, being erased. Because if we were holding onto each other... at least we wouldn't be alone.
sighs. "...I blame myself for not going home with her that day. Even though I know it would have ended the same way."
reaches over and pats him on the shoulder wordlessly.
: Just... It feels like if everything had been the tiniest bit different, she'd be here, right now.
: ... y-yeah. Believe me, I... know that feel.
: I'd give anything to see her one more time. Just... To say goodbye.
: But she can't have wanted it to be like that. She always liked to make the most out of everything.
: She's around you now. Sort of. She became a part of the c-city... the static that composes her is all around us still...
: Probably yelling at me from beyond the grave.
: Probably. Do you want me to... keep going?
: Please.
: This... Is all I've got.

: We had to think about it a lot. What we'd do if one of us was erased. What we'd do... at all. The challenges made us think about it. On the fourth day, partners, Sef and Rori, were forced to fight each other. Luna and I agreed... no matter what the stakes were, we'd never raise a hand to each other like that. Never actually hurt each other. The two of us were going to get out /together/, win /together/, or not at all. Even when I was scared and didn't think I could make it, that I would just be useless, I kept fighting for her. When she felt she was scared and selfish and didn't deserve to come back to life as opposed to anyone else who'd been erased, she kept fighting for me. We had to keep fighting for each other. No matter what. Because our lives were tied to each other... to not fight meant to kill each other. We clung to each other instead... and tried to give each other the strength necessary to continue on. She fought for you, in the end. To get back and see you, one last time. To see... what good she could do... in this world.
: ...Then I suppose it falls to me, to carry the burden she chose.
: And should I fail, I won't let the flame burn out, either.
: Good a reason for fighting as any, huh?
: Yes, I suppose so.
: To put it in her own words, 'and light the whole fucking district on fire.'
: ...Who better to set the world ablaze than the sun itself?
: You're gonna go far, kid.
: Maybe. Maybe not. ...Nothing is certain.
: The few things I thought were... Proved me wrong.
pats him again. Her eyes are tightly closed.
: And that is exactly why we have to fight.
smiles.
: Nothing is permanent. It's the fleeting seconds that make life so precious.

: The end of the sixth day, we saw four people be erased in a single fight we couldn't get out of and most of the rest of us be hurt... before the wild Noise bounced. Took out four of us in the forms of our dead friends and bounced away, leaving the surviving Players an utter wreck. The Game wasn't fun anymore. Nothing about it was fun. The night before the final battle, Luna and I slept cuddled on the floor in Ochre, trying not to be so scared or cry. Neither of us really thought we could do it anymore.
listens, quiet now.
: We woke up together on the last day. Set up speakers. I was on guitar, she was singing along. For hours, we lost ourselves in music and tried not to be af-f-fraid...
is openly crying now, unable to help it.
pats
: ... she beat up a shopkeeper. Kin. I never did learn why.
: Come to think of it, that's the same shopkeeper she told me she owned for a bit. Because he was thrown at her? And then plushies were made.
: Wow.
: This sure is an interesting place.
: In the final battle, she was beautiful. She was /brilliant/.
: There were eight of us left. Seven of us were united by hatred and anger.
: ... and then there was Luna.
still listening, quiet once more.
silently clutches Little Luna, all that's left now.

: Over the course of the Week, we'd gotten good at talking people through their problems, playing amateur therapist, and trying to use the true power of friendship and kindness to redeem everyone we met. It was working on the foreign reapers. On everyone. Far too well.
: ... Luna was the only one who didn't stop when it came to Jessamyn.
: Jessamyn?
: The GM of that week. Her character can be summed up in one word-- yandere.
nods.

: We were fighting, and Luna was talking. The other seven of us hated Jess by then. Or... rather, I... still loved her... it doesn't matter now. But Luna was talking. She was trying to convince Jess that it didn't have to be this way-- Jess /hated/ the Game. Luna was the one who said that nobody else had to die, that Jessamyn could be forgiven, that we could all walk out of here. That we'd come back and visit Jess like we would our reaper friends.
: ... it got the other seven of us to stop, and think a bit.
: Asahi never believed it for a moment. He couldn't stop trying to take Jess down.
: The rest of us... or, mostly...
: We started trying, too.
: To try to convince Jess that it didn't have to be like this. That she didn't have to kill us and we didn't have to kill her and there could be some fucked up happy ending.
listens intently. He knows the story is nearly over, and happy endings don't exist in this world.
: ... sh-she didn't have a healing pin. Luna.
: Of... of everything... to have overlooked, she didn't... have a healing pin...
: I should have got her one, but I thought she'd get it on her own, that it'd be fine... and then... she was poisoned.
: She was always more concerned with being on the offense. I suppose it never occurred to her.
: I saw how much the poison was affecting her. Every time she moved. Three more turns, and...
: And it all fell apart?
: ... in three turns, she was going to die, and there was nothing, not a thing, that either she or I or /anyone/ could do aside from stand there and fight and watch her be drained.
: And if your partner is erased... you only have seven minutes left to live without a pact.
: I held her as she died. I clung to her even more and I thought that it'd be over for me in seven minutes too. I told her I loved her. Again.
: ... and then the announcement came as she shattered to static in my arms. 'Luna has been erased.'
is silently holding back tears. It's one thing to know something, and another to know the details.
: ... and then the announcement I wasn't expecting came. 'Altair has been erased.' Leaving his partner Asahi standing there alone, just as heartbroken as I was.
: Asahi and I repacted to save our lives and had to keep on fighting, even if we didn't want to... for each other, and for the other four. Juste, Misae, Kafu, and Miyu...
: ... it wasn't too long afterwards that Misae and Miyu were erased in the same move.
: Juste and Kafu repacted.
: And then... and then...
: It started... working...
: What did?
: What Luna had started... was working, and Jessamyn began to attack herself... instead of us... she just wanted it to be over...

: All four of us lost our partners in that fight, the one thing we thought would never happen. None of us ever expected to be able to keep fighting and carry on without them. It was assumed that, in a fight, we'd die.
: But in the end... they died, and we're... still here.
: The last thing she told me was to tell you everything that happened, to be happy, and to light the whole fucking district on fire.
: ...Then I guess I've finally got something to strive for.
: Sol? If you do nothing else, /get a fucking healing pin/.
: I'll make sure of it.
: Good. You can't go down like she did.
: First, though, I'm going to need some matches...

: And I fully intend to survive. Somebody has to make sure no one is forgotten, don't they?
: I mean, the four of us are doing that ourselves, but... yeah. Keep up that fighting spirit.
holds out the fluffy patchwork cat. "But if I do burn as short and bright as she did... Will you hold onto this? She trusted you with it before, after all."
: ... y-yeah. Still, keep it with you for the Game. I'll find it if you join the city.

: And I can't let go of it now. It's all I have of her... Besides stories, memories, and a voice in my head.
